comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
Great Moments in OH&S !

The 'Kulgoa' was built in 1905,  42.6 metres, 1255 passengers (preferably not all on one side!). 
(ref.  Graeme Andrews - 'Pictorial History of Ferries', Reed,1982).  

From the ladies' frocks and hats,  I would say pre WW1.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] OH&S indeed! Thank you for that information beachcomberaustralia, our records have been updated.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
Full details of the 'Kulgoa' when new - Australian Town and Country Journal 18/01/1905 p.39, col.4 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/page/5711140 . Including this -
" The Kulgoa's moulded beam is 3ft 6in more than the Koree ... ... This will be found a considerable advantage when carrying large numbers of passengers, more particularly when the passengers get on one side [ ! ]. The resistance being so much greater, the vessel will not heel over, as is the case with other steamers. "

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Thanks beachcomberaustralia. A fascinating article that seems to add colour and historical context to this photograph!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
